lines.text: See, that's the difference between you and me, and why you live here and I'm just passing through.
You like Patsy Cline? I just love her. I wonder how come she don't put out no more new records.
Because she's dead.
Oh... that's sad. Don't that make you sad?
I've had time to get over it.
I bet right now, you don't know if you want to kill me... or fuck me.
Your lies are old but you tell them pretty good.
You're just an ignorant, inbred, tumbleweed hick.
Darrell, 40,000 thousand people die every day. How come you're not one of 'em?
I don't think you know who I am. The name's Toby N. Tucker. People round here call me TNT. You know why?
Because they're not very imaginative?
'Cause I'm just like dynamite, boy, and when I go off, somebody gets hurt.

[sitting on a bed, appearing as if she is about to seduce Bobby]
Come here. You know what I wanna do? I wanna hang drapes...
[gets up and walks off]
You're a man without scruples. Oh, I can smell it on you.

[Rubs his hand on Bobby's sweaty hair, then smells it]
Yeah, that's the sweat of a man that hasn't an honest bone in his body.
Is everybody fucking everybody in this crazy God damn town?
It's not just a car. It's a sixty-four-and-a-half Mustang convertible.
Is everyone in this town on drugs?
Damn. Gonna be another hot one today. Sometimes I don't even want to get out of bed. Course, I don't want to get out for the cold ones neither.
Everything is everything. And everything is nothing, too.
And here I made you all hot and sweaty...
And a waitress named Flo.
I don't know whether to fuck you... or kill you!
I got a mind to put you over my knee right now and paddle your ass raw!

[having sex with Grace from behind]
Oh, fuck it away, fuck it away! But it ain't ever gonna go away!
Now you can fuckin' take it, or you can fuckin' leave it.
She liked fuckin' her papa.
Listen to me you stupid fuck...
No! You listen to me goddamnit! Ya sorry son of a bitch! You owe me money! And this car aint goin' no place 'till I get it!

Don't you want to know? Was Jake my father? Was I fucking my daddy? Yes, I was! I was fucking my daddy! And I married him! I married him, okay? I just wanted to be a kid. And they took that from me. They treated me like meat. A piece of meat. Fuck him! Fuck the whole town, they deserve to die!

[laughing insanely]
You hit me... Bobby!
[stops laughing]
You motherfucker!
I'm here to get my car back.
You got the money?
[Bobby gives him the money]
Two hundred dollars in hundred dollar bills, this morning you was flat out broke.
That's none of your fucking business.
I don't want no dirty money. I run a clean business!

[walks in on Bobby and Grace kissing]
Grace!
Jake! I thought you were in Phoenix.
Who the hell is this?
Who the hell are you?
I'm her husband!
Husband?

[looks at Jake]
What about him?
Let him watch. I want him to know what he's missing.
[last lines]
...Arizona.
Fuck you, Superior!
I'm about 50% Indian.

[Sarcastically]
Congratulations.
You're pretty full of yourself.
Yeah, I like that about me.
You're a slimy bastard who'd have his wife killed to get his hands on some money.
What does that make you?
The slimy bastard that's gonna' do it.

[Threatening Bobby in the street]
That tears it, mister. I'm gonna' bust you up but good. I'm gonna' take you and break you into a million pieces, and... take those pieces and break 'em into a million more. You don't even know what you're dealing with here, mister. I'm crazy - I'm *psycho* crazy!
I don't want to go to Mexico, Bobby. I want to stay with you. Don't you think I care about you?
I think you're a lying, backstabbing, psycho bitch... and one day you'll kill me. But it's nice to know you care.
Ya think bad, then bad's what ya get.
That's a pretty decent philosophy you got there.
Yeah, well, no charge.
You think bad, and bad's what you'll get.
That's an interesting philosophy there, Darrell.
Yeah. And no charge.
It's the desert that makes you crazy. The loneliness out here. Nobody to talk to. People on the run.
Bye, Mister. Don't go nowhere without me. I wanna have your love child.
A man with no ethics is a free man. I don't envy you that.

[having sex with Grace from behind]
You've been a bad girl, Grace!
You don't know what you're fighting for!
My honour! That's what I'm fighting for!
I'll beat you so bad I'll make your mother sick!

[indicates his two missing fingers]
You should be more careful.
Yeah I know...

[as he walks into the town of Superior for the first time]
Just like a town, only uglier.
What do you do?
A little of this, a little of that. Mostly I tell fortunes.
What brings you to Superior, Bobby?
Car overheated.
Darrell taking good care of you, is he?
Darrell's dumb as a sack of hammers.
